snippet: The family of Jeff Bauman, who lost his legs in the bombings, learned of his fate from an image of the bloodied young man being tended to by a man in a cowboy hat.
abstract: Family of Jeff Bauman, who lost both his legs in Boston Marathon bombings, learned of his fate from photograph image of bloodied young man being tended to by man in cowboy hat.

byline.contributor: Binyamin Appelbaum contributed reporting from Boston, and Kitty Bennett contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: The family of Jeff Bauman, who lost his legs in the bombings, learned of his fate from an image of the bloodied young man being tended to by a man in a cowboy hat.

headline.main: In Grisly Image, a Father Sees His Son
headline.print_headline: In Signal Image From Boston Bombing, a Father Sees His Son
